articles.title: CBI Busts Transnational Cyber-Fraud Network, 17 Charged
articles.summary: The Central Bureau of Investigation filed a chargesheet against 17 accused in a transnational cyber‑fraud network after overnight raids and forensic probes; the operation targeted call‑centre rings operating across multiple states and abroad, and seized devices and banking records to map proceeds of crime, sources said late last night in New Delhi.

articles.title: Delhi Records Severe Air Pollution; AQI Hits 461 Overnight
articles.summary: Delhi's air quality worsened overnight, with the Central Pollution Control Board reporting an AQI of 461 in parts of the city, classed as 'severe', disrupting flight operations and raising health advisories for vulnerable groups across the capital region, officials said in early‑morning updates.

articles.title: Punjab Rural Polls See Low Turnout, Opposition Alleges Violence
articles.summary: Rural zila parishad and block samiti polling in Punjab concluded overnight with a reported turnout of about 48%, and opposition parties alleged instances of violence and intimidation at several booths, prompting calls for a probe and the filing of complaints with state election authorities, according to party statements and reporting late last night.

articles.title: Woman Stabbed To Death Inside Delhi Temple; One Arrested
articles.summary: Police in Delhi arrested one suspect after a 48‑year‑old woman was found stabbed inside a temple late last night; investigators say motive is under inquiry while forensic teams processed the scene and the accused was taken for questioning, officials told reporters in the early hours.

articles.title: NIA To File Chargesheet Today In Jammu Explosion Case
articles.summary: The National Investigation Agency prepared to file a chargesheet today in connection with a recent explosion in Jammu after concluding overnight evidence consolidation and witness statements; the move follows searches and seizure operations across multiple locations tied to the probe, officials stated.

articles.title: One Killed, Two Injured In Jalandhar Scrap‑shop Blast
articles.summary: A blast at a scrap shop in Jalandhar late last night killed one person and injured two others; local police said emergency services responded overnight, the deceased has been identified, and an investigation into the cause of the explosion is under way.

articles.title: Maharashtra Announces Mumbai–Hyderabad Expressway, Metro Expansion
articles.summary: In a late‑night address during the winter session, Maharashtra's deputy chief minister announced plans for a Mumbai–Hyderabad expressway, expansion of Mumbai metro lines and proposed power tariff reductions aimed at accelerating connectivity and easing urban energy costs across the state.

articles.title: CAG Issues Report Citing Fiscal Indiscipline, Last‑Minute Spending
articles.summary: The Comptroller and Auditor General released a report overnight criticizing a state government's fiscal indiscipline, highlighting underspending on revenue lines, low capital expenditure execution, and increased last‑minute expenses that raise accountability questions ahead of budget planning, the CAG document showed.

articles.title: Gurugram Police Recruit 450 Residents As 'Cyber Marshals'
articles.summary: Gurugram police launched a community cyber‑safety initiative late last night, onboarding 450 resident volunteers as 'Cyber Marshals' to disseminate fraud alerts and digital safety tips in housing societies as part of a broader effort to curb online scams.

articles.title: Karnataka Prisons Chief Seizes 13 Phones, Drugs In Overnight Crackdown
articles.summary: Karnataka's new prisons director ordered a statewide overnight crackdown that led to the seizure of 13 mobile phones and contraband packets inside multiple detention centres; authorities said the action was part of immediate reform measures after his appointment.
